title: Which of the following is NOT a valid PHP comparison operator?
How is the comparison of objects done in PHP?
answer_1: We use the operator '===' to test t wo objects are instanced from the s ame class and have same attributes and equal values.
answer_2: We use the operator '==' to test tw o objects are instanced from the sa me class and have same attributes a nd equal values.
answer_3: We use the operator '=' to test two objects are instanced from the sam e class and have same attributes an d equal values.
right_answer: We use the operator '==' to test tw o objects are instanced from the sa me class and have same attributes a nd equal values.
